data.title: Dispose some sound streams
data.body: Make sure we dispose these streams as soon as we are done with them, rather than having to let the finalizer clear them up.

data.title: Timed external conditions cannot be reset
data.body: e.g. the Iron Curtain in RA.  It should be possible to apply a second curtain charge to an already curtained unit to reset the timer.

data.title: Complete Upgrades -> Condition transition.
data.body: Closes #12380.

data.title: openra fails to start on osx 10.12.2
data.body: After I upgrade to osx 10.12.2, openra can not start any more. Thanks! Previous version of osx is fine.

data.title: OutOfMemory
data.body:
Ticket combining OutOfMemory issues into one.

Other tickets (closed some as they will not contain enough information for us to solve them individually):
#5116
#8073
#8494
#9739
#11300
#11489
#12342
#12412

I currently suspect the graphics drivers are eating up most of our virtual memory for textures - and the `System.OutOfMemoryException` indicates our teeny 32-bit address space is being exhausted. This seems to be the case indicated in #12125, but that is for the texture heavy RA2 so we'd need to confirm it for the default mods. If anybody gets this crash again that contains the extra logging added in #12014 - that will help to narrow down whether that is the case or not.

data.title: If connection fails ESC button gets ignored

Like the title, if server gets offline you can't press ESC to get out of the game but have to press the cog in the top right corner with mouse left button then press exit.

See: #12314

data.title: Abort installation if .NET 4.5 isn't installed.

data.title: UI rendering is too expensive
data.body:
hi,
i wanted to try the mono profiler, to see what output it generates.
i played a skirmich game for a few minutes with profiling enabled.
in the report generated these method appear with the highest self-time (time spent in method itself). you should read the list bottom up.

it seems Widget get_ChildOrigin and get_RenderOrigin are called over 33million times in those few minutes. In total over 5+ and 2+ seconds in spent in both method. 

when i read it the source it seem RenderOrigin calls ChildOrigin.

perhaps you would like to optimize these method. 
- Not use a properties (get/set), but directly access the Bounds member as a variable.
- If Parent == null, return a int2(Bounds.X, Bounds.Y) with adding int2.Zero, save 2 additions of zero
- Store Bounds.X and Bounds.Y as a int2 class variable. Avoiding the need for int2(Bounds.X, Bounds.Y) each time.
- Remove ChildOrigin as it calls RenderOrigin directly, saving a function call.
- EventBounds calls RenderBounds, remove one, save a function call.
- GetEventBounds, already has a PERF comment, 
- Vertex constructor is called a lot, probably difficult to optimize.
- Try to remove the iterator/MoveNext


Top 200, sorted by second column, asc, self time:
```
    1177     1177   19462508 System.Collections.Generic.List'1:get_Item (int)
    3611     1335    5312374 System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary'2:TryGetValue (TKey,TValue&)
    1359     1359   29306473 System.Drawing.Color:get_Value ()
    2301     1359    5534810 OpenRA.TraitDictionary/TraitContainer'1/AllEnumerator:get_Current ()
    5014     1409    5368516 System.Linq.Enumerable/<CreateSelectIterator>c__Iterator10'2<OpenRA.Primitives.Pair'2<OpenRA.ISync, System.Func'2<object, int>>, OpenRA.Actor/SyncHash>:MoveNext ()
    1412     1412   22392054 OpenRA.Graphics.Vertex:.ctor (single,single,single,single,single,single,single,single,single)
    1484     1441     952658 string:IndexOfOrdinalUnchecked (string,int,int)
    1485     1485   23997680 System.Collections.Generic.List'1/Enumerator:MoveNext ()
    5756     1826    3328439 OpenRA.Graphics.Util:FastCreateQuad (OpenRA.Graphics.Vertex[],OpenRA.float3,OpenRA.float3,OpenRA.float3,OpenRA.float3,OpenRA.Graphics.Sprite,single,int)
    1913     1913   35386758 **OpenRA.int2:op_Addition** (OpenRA.int2,OpenRA.int2)
    1979     1979   34174275 OpenRA.float3:.ctor (single,single,single)
    2099     2099      10567 (wrapper managed-to-native) SDL2.SDL:SDL_GL_SwapWindow (intptr)
   77587     2171    4525482 **OpenRA.Widgets.Widget:GetEventBounds** ()
   32787     2773   28173996 **OpenRA.Widgets.Widget:get_ChildOrigin** ()
    4384     2971   22392054 **OpenRA.Graphics.Vertex:.ctor** (OpenRA.float3,single,single,single,single,single,single)
    3675     3675     415808 (wrapper managed-to-native) object:wrapper_native_0x7f1bc8aa8000 (int,int,int)
    4310     4310   12837046 (wrapper managed-to-native) object:__icall_wrapper_mono_array_new_specific (intptr,int)
   42614     5613   33829812 **OpenRA.Widgets.Widget:get_RenderOrigin** ()
    7020     7020   20634059 (wrapper managed-to-native) object:__icall_wrapper_mono_object_new_specific (intptr)
   37296    37296       5426 (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Threading.Thread:Sleep_internal (int)
  160332   160332       1300 (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Net.Sockets.Socket:Select_internal (System.Net.Sockets.Socket[]&,int,int&)
  160715   160715       1489 (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Net.Sockets.Socket:Receive_internal (intptr,byte[],int,int,System.Net.Sockets.SocketFlags,int&)
  223813   223813      12719 (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Threading.WaitHandle:WaitOne_internal (System.Threading.WaitHandle,intptr,int,bool)
```


not sure if you guys often watch profiler output. i

data.title: Touchpad Gestures and Touchscreen support
data.body:
I'd like to propose implementing a common interface for input devices which translates specific input events (e.g. three finger swipe on a macbook trackpad...) coming from a myriad of input devices (like touchscreens, trackpads, mice, gamepads etc...) into general game events (like moving a unit somewhere or selecting a few units etc..) so, for example, touch screen controls on windows 10 tablets can be made more pleasant (I don't actually own a windows 10 tablet, however i can't imagine that simply treating touch events like a mouse could be as intuitive as it should be). 

The reasoning behind this proposal is that I sometimes like to play a bit of OpenRA casually on my Macbook, however most often without a mouse, although it's not too bad of an experience, I'd like to implement proper trackpad gestures like multiselecting with a three swinger swipe across the trackpad or focusing on the MCV with a three finger double tap on the trackpad, just to name a few examples. I think that this could be a major improvement to the experience overall and by having a proper plugabble driver-like architecture in the engine for input devices, we could make the gameplay more pleasant across the board and therefore attract more players. I personally think that having such an architecture where everybody could write "drivers" against would benefit the project immensly and I would be willing to do the necessary work (after exams...) of implementing my proposal. With a common input architecture, we could also make a TV-mode, which would work surprisingly well (I played Red Alert on my Playstation 1 back in the days) without duplicated effort

data.title: Fixed Open.Nat directory name case
data.body: On GNU/Linux the directory would not be found during `cp` and `rm` because name Open.NAT was created as Open.Nat.

data.title: MiGs and YAKs return to base when using 'stop' hotkey
data.body: They already do this with the 'deploy' hotkey. As with Longbow/Hinds they ought to just stop, or in this case start idling. Perhaps, if possible, also with a predefined clockwise or counterclockwise path for predictability. That would make MiGs/YAKs more viable as spotters when positioned close to enemy AA.

data.title: Avoid querying traits from dead minelayers.
data.body: Fixes #12446.

data.title: [bleed] Remove AI capturing from TD and RA, and AIs using mechanics and medics in RA
data.body:
The AI unit code didn't see any work or interest this cycle, so this cherry-picks #12212 onto bleed to avoid regressions in the next playtest.

Closes #12206.
~~Closes~~ Works around #11981 for our default mods.

Fixes #12316.
Fixes #12473.

' cp: could not evaluate « ./Open.NAT/lib/net45/Open.Nat.dll » '

I fixed the source directory name which is Open.Nat on my system when downloaded with nuget.

data.title: Remove Game.RunAfterDelay from SwallowActor
data.body:
RunAfterDelay might be potentially problematic for savegame support.
A delay of 1 second isn't enough to justify some work-around, in my opinion, it's easier to just play the notification and radar ping immediately.

data.title: Add RequiresPower trait on Production trait [feature]
data.body:
Hi,
if a building is able to be powered down, then it also should stop producing stuff. This has currently no impact since all producing structures can't be powered down, but it would be nice to have the option to make production structures power-down-able.

This came up when trying to add a production queue to the d2k outpost.

Maybe a solution would be to add a boolean sub-trait `RequiresPower` to the `Production` trait, which enables production of a certain queue on a unit/structure. Or just geneally disable production when powered down ( != low power).

Advantage of the `RequiresPower` trait would be, that it is a general concept which can be applied to may building traits (compare C&C3, where you could power down everything). Disabling/Stopping is of course simpler and maybe a more straight forward rule.

Cheers,
---SirCake

Cheers,

data.body: The rule changes are mainly reorganizing inherits to fix cases where conditions are granted but not used or visa versa.  This also sneaks in the TS crate stat bonus changes @GraionDilach requested in #12381, and supersedes #12476.

data.title: RA content installer test files don't exist on original CDs.
data.body: `eahelp.GID` and `automenu.apm` were added in the later freeware isos.  To fix this properly we need to add support for defining a data range to sha1, and then test the first kB or so of main.mix.

data.title: Mammoth Tank incorrect BuildDuration value
data.body:
I looked at vehicles.yaml. Apparently Mammoth Tank and MCV are the only vehicles with BuildDuration and BuildDurationModifier values.

Both vehicles have BuildDurationModifier set to 40. MCV BuildDuration value is set as cost of MCV in $. Mammoth Tank BuildDuration value is 2500 even though it costs $2000. I get the feeling this is not intended. I would imagine Mammoth is supposed to have same production speed as MCV because they have same BuildDurationModifier.

This results into MCV cost / build time to be around 62,5 $/s. Mammoth tank is 50 $/s. All other units are ~40 $/s.

data.title: Game Not Starting And Causing Reboots
data.body:
I've been attempting to run the 20161019 version of OpenRA, on my Sony Vaio VGN-NR310E. While doing so, the game sort of "sputtered" while loading and caused the computer to restart. I've pulled up the error logs, but there's nothing in them. The included text below is the contents from one of two text files which was labeled "exception-2016-12-10T022430Z"

Date: 2016-12-10 02:24:30Z
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Failed to initialize platform-integration library. Check graphics.log for details.
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

I've tried installing the manufacturer's drivers for the GPU, but it didn't help. The GPU is an Intel 900 series unit and I have Dot Net 4.5 installed.
